intro: Scorzonera filifolia, commonly known as the filifoliate scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine, thread-like hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Scorzonera filifolia is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
